subject: Respect rolling update params on the initial batch
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-08-26 23:31:36.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/resources/openstack/heat/instance_group.py', 'heat/scaling/rolling_update.py', 'heat/tests/autoscaling/test_rolling_update.py', 'heat/tests/test_instance_group.py'], 'message': "Respect rolling update params on the initial batch

Don't count members that are being created (in order to temporarily
increase the effective capacity to meet the minimum-in-service as batched
updates occur) as being in-service until they are actually finished. Also,
ensure that only a maximum of batch-size resources are either created or
updated to the new definition in each batch.

This also bring the implementation of InstanceGroup and the
AutoscalingGroups into line with ResourceGroup, and allows ResourceGroup to
make use of the heat.scaling.rolling_update library functions in the
future.

Change-Id: I912daff18716cee0d445e96a6d2d50f22192260c
Partially-Implements: blueprint scaling-group-common
Closes-Bug: #1488971
"}]
commit_message:
Respect rolling update params on the initial batch

Don't count members that are being created (in order to temporarily
increase the effective capacity to meet the minimum-in-service as batched
updates occur) as being in-service until they are actually finished. Also,
ensure that only a maximum of batch-size resources are either created or
updated to the new definition in each batch.

This also bring the implementation of InstanceGroup and the
AutoscalingGroups into line with ResourceGroup, and allows ResourceGroup to
make use of the heat.scaling.rolling_update library functions in the
future.

Change-Id: I912daff18716cee0d445e96a6d2d50f22192260c
Partially-Implements: blueprint scaling-group-common
Closes-Bug: #1488971

subject: Don't set MYSQL_DRIVER in local.conf.sample.
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-08-26 14:53:37.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/local.conf.sample'], 'message': "Don't set MYSQL_DRIVER in local.conf.sample.

local.conf.sample set MYSQL_DRIVER=MySQL-python to match what was
being done in OpenStack CI for Neutron.  This is no longer the case as
the related issues in Neutron have mostly been solved.

OpenStack CI for OVN was already running on the new MYSQL_DRIVER
default, but this change will make local runs of devstack use the new
default, too.

Change-Id: Ie3ac5f0e8e23559884bef7bb234448b1bca2515e
Signed-off-by: Russell Bryant <rbryant@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Don't set MYSQL_DRIVER in local.conf.sample.

local.conf.sample set MYSQL_DRIVER=MySQL-python to match what was
being done in OpenStack CI for Neutron.  This is no longer the case as
the related issues in Neutron have mostly been solved.

OpenStack CI for OVN was already running on the new MYSQL_DRIVER
default, but this change will make local runs of devstack use the new
default, too.

Change-Id: Ie3ac5f0e8e23559884bef7bb234448b1bca2515e
Signed-off-by: Russell Bryant <rbryant@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Update documentation for multiple VLAN ranges

Update example configuration file and installation guide to
mention support for multiple VLAN ranges on a particular
network and provide examples. Also address other minor
issues with networking content in the installation guide.

Change-Id: Idca97092f326cfbd83a018e853d3e7655d20e491
Partial-Bug: #1475436
(cherry picked from commit c3025ed093e80fbb1d7ed91651341fe139102436)

commit_message:
Fix OVS bond for l23network module

* Add lacp states calculation
* Rise error if bridge is not defined for ovs provider
* Add bridge creation for ovs bonds
* Add ordering for l3::ifconfig
* Up parent interface for vlan port
* Correct condition for bond port

Change-Id: I463368e6d6a48cf1a92113b4fc75cc87ebf08020
Closes-bug: #1488566

subject: Avoid envirnoment marker parsing error
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-07-15 21:49:50.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt'], 'message': "Avoid envirnoment marker parsing error

Having comments in lines with an environment marker seems to cause
a parsing error. For example, in the networking-ovn project:

error in setup command:
  Invalid environment marker: (python_version=='2.7' # Apache-2.0)

Removing the comments allows devstack to complete successfully.

Change-Id: I80a1f381df2344d1bc323bad44cceb83f40bd8d0
"}]
commit_message:
Avoid envirnoment marker parsing error

Having comments in lines with an environment marker seems to cause
a parsing error. For example, in the networking-ovn project:

error in setup command:
  Invalid environment marker: (python_version=='2.7' # Apache-2.0)

Removing the comments allows devstack to complete successfully.

Change-Id: I80a1f381df2344d1bc323bad44cceb83f40bd8d0

They should only require the API to manage security groups, which

Change-Id: I3f7737e9d3803c8813ee0d4d9271248743ecaf1e
Signed-off-by: Russell Bryant <rbryant@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
devstackgaterc: Run some security group tests.

I think that this subset of security group tests are fine to run.
They should only require the API to manage security groups, which
should be working.

Change-Id: I3f7737e9d3803c8813ee0d4d9271248743ecaf1e
Signed-off-by: Russell Bryant <rbryant@redhat.com>

Add external_gateway_info in router-create command

This patch adds provision to set the gateway of the router
in the router-create command itself.

Change-Id: Id070df859b783c40d537dd659e119127727c3a4c
Closes-Bug: 1475638

subject: fixed subnetpool-create option '--pool-prefix' to positional arg
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-07-24 09:02:36.000000000', 'files': ['neutronclient/neutron/v2_0/subnetpool.py'], 'message': "fixed subnetpool-create option '--pool-prefix' to positional arg

The option '--pool-prefix' is needed,this option is in optional
arguments group.So move this option to positional arguments.

Change-Id: I6a7051e51b3e06d2fa63b6beb7c384e446c309df
Closes-Bug:#1477889
"}]
commit_message:
fixed subnetpool-create option '--pool-prefix' to positional arg

The option '--pool-prefix' is needed,this option is in optional
arguments group.So move this option to positional arguments.

Change-Id: I6a7051e51b3e06d2fa63b6beb7c384e446c309df
Closes-Bug:#1477889

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-06-05 05:23:38.000000000', 'files': ['neutron_vpnaas/services/vpn/device_drivers/template/openswan/ipsec.conf.template', 'neutron_vpnaas/services/vpn/device_drivers/ipsec.py'], 'message': "IPv6 support for OpenSwan, Libreswan and Strongswan

VPNaaS is not working with IPv6 addresses.
This patch will address the below issues and make VPNaas
work with IPv6 addresses

1)ipsec doesn't need nat rule for ipv6. So not adding this for ipv6.
This issue is applicable for openSwan, libreswan and strongswan.

The below two issues are seen only on openswan and libreswan.
No changes are required to strongswan template files to support ipv6.
2)Add 'connaddrfamily=ipv6' to ipsec.conf for whack to parse all
addresses in the config as ipv6 addresses.

3)openswan fails to process ipv6 address from %defaultroute, so
explicitly pass the gateway address as leftnexthop address.

(cherry picked from commit c315cff05364664a5872c6a5dc6b9dc2d24fab39)

Change-Id: I74832be4476bd36cdcd4234b30d0daee24ef61ce
Closes-bug: #1435136
Closes-bug: #1436263
Closes-bug: #1436890
Upstream-Liberty: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/175796/

commit_message:
IPv6 support for OpenSwan, Libreswan and Strongswan

VPNaaS is not working with IPv6 addresses.
This patch will address the below issues and make VPNaas
work with IPv6 addresses

1)ipsec doesn't need nat rule for ipv6. So not adding this for ipv6.
This issue is applicable for openSwan, libreswan and strongswan.

The below two issues are seen only on openswan and libreswan.
No changes are required to strongswan template files to support ipv6.
2)Add 'connaddrfamily=ipv6' to ipsec.conf for whack to parse all
addresses in the config as ipv6 addresses.

3)openswan fails to process ipv6 address from %defaultroute, so
explicitly pass the gateway address as leftnexthop address.

(cherry picked from commit c315cff05364664a5872c6a5dc6b9dc2d24fab39)

Change-Id: I74832be4476bd36cdcd4234b30d0daee24ef61ce
Closes-bug: #1435136
Closes-bug: #1436263
Closes-bug: #1436890
Upstream-Liberty: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/175796/

This is a dependent/child fix of patch 179439.
Change-Id: I8e94063009b29fab4f990674292989aaca572491

When an unbound port gets associated with an FIP entry in DVR
environment, this port needs to be identified as a DVR service port
in order for DVR schedulers to know it is serviceable by DVR routers.
A predefined DVR owner,"network:dvr_service_port", is added to serve
this purpose. In unbound port creation/update scenario, user will
need to specify this predefined owner in order for neutron to recognize
it is a DVR service port. There are some use cases the tenant will use
the unbound port in DVR environment such as "VRRP".

Without this fix, there is a chance that FIP agent gateway port will
get deleted on the DVR host as the system would think there is no
DVR service port presented, because this port is not tagged as DVR
serviceable. This would happen when a port is disassociated from
floating IP entry. At that point, system performs the check if FIP
agent gateway port is DVR serviceable on the host based on the device
owner type. If it is not, the port get deleted. However, in reality,
this port should not get deleted.

Change-Id: Ibee294f674c2f6978ffc50b95aefcba5f402325a
Closes-Bug: #1447034

commit_message:
Add predefined DVR device owner for FIP w/unbound

This is a dependent/child fix of patch 179439.
Change-Id: I8e94063009b29fab4f990674292989aaca572491

When an unbound port gets associated with an FIP entry in DVR
environment, this port needs to be identified as a DVR service port
in order for DVR schedulers to know it is serviceable by DVR routers.
A predefined DVR owner,"network:dvr_service_port", is added to serve
this purpose. In unbound port creation/update scenario, user will
need to specify this predefined owner in order for neutron to recognize
it is a DVR service port. There are some use cases the tenant will use
the unbound port in DVR environment such as "VRRP".

Without this fix, there is a chance that FIP agent gateway port will
get deleted on the DVR host as the system would think there is no
DVR service port presented, because this port is not tagged as DVR
serviceable. This would happen when a port is disassociated from
floating IP entry. At that point, system performs the check if FIP
agent gateway port is DVR serviceable on the host based on the device
owner type. If it is not, the port get deleted. However, in reality,
this port should not get deleted.

Change-Id: Ibee294f674c2f6978ffc50b95aefcba5f402325a
Closes-Bug: #1447034

commit_message:
Adding New tables for vyatta vrrp info

Adding 2 tables to map the relation between
vyatta_vrouter_instances :
    Router_id Instance_id vrrp_priority
vyatta_vrouter_port :
    port_id router_port_id instance_id vrrp_group

Change-Id: I8f14ba350265531dbb0c7a7f1198352f1cf9df89
Closes-Bug: #1478308

Add Nuage plugin configuration parameters.

The Nuage plugin can handle floating ip rate limiting. This commit adds
two new parameters to the plugin config file, related to the floating ip
rate limiting of Nuage.

The helper method "_create_delete_ro_access_rule" used by the tests
targeting user rules will actually create ip based rules.

This can easily be fixed by using the access_type and access_to
attributes instead of the hardcoded values.

Closes-Bug: #1489359

Change-Id: Ie81537c53744f33c10a6d0e0d584a6f355e47407
'}]
commit_message:
Fix Tempest tests targeting user based access rules

The helper method "_create_delete_ro_access_rule" used by the tests
targeting user rules will actually create ip based rules.

This can easily be fixed by using the access_type and access_to
attributes instead of the hardcoded values.

Closes-Bug: #1489359

Change-Id: Ie81537c53744f33c10a6d0e0d584a6f355e47407

commit_message:
Fix Python 3 issues

* Replace unicode() with six.text_type
* Replace basestring with six.string_types
* Add unit tests for User.has_perms()

This change is required to port Horizon to Python 3.

Partial-Implements: blueprint porting-python3
Change-Id: I028a37d51ba1eda69336d4c81a47606f7c66f83f

As the API validation code always return 400 when request with
invalid json body, so 400 is an available status code for all the

Change-Id: I0454e95cd0655c910fad8b39ead2b5edab216b68
Related-Bug: 1471239

commit_message:
Add a note about the 400 response not requiring a microversion

As the API validation code always return 400 when request with
invalid json body, so 400 is an available status code for all the
Nova API. Then no microversion bump required for fixing 500 to 400.

Change-Id: I0454e95cd0655c910fad8b39ead2b5edab216b68
Related-Bug: 1471239

commit_message:
Stop doing any magic cloning of neutron during CI

Hopefully this will allow the Zuul "Depends-On" thing to work better.
Adopting the solution developed by Doug Wiegley for LBaaS:
c61f920f2a54fd829ee37484b3743ab77b909847

commit_message:
Adding clone feature to Transfer Table

Currently, it is a pain to create a transfer table. A user must create two
separate templates: one for allocated and one for available. Both
templates are nearly identical with subtle differences. It would be great if
we can write one template and clone it. This would remove a lot of
boilerplate templates.

For a demo of the feature, take a look at dependent patch,
pay close attention to select-projects.html
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/202315/

Change-Id: I0c2cdae8a8994d37abaf22fa6921991c0d6485b3
Implements: blueprint transfer-table-clone-feature

[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-08-27 11:09:57.000000000', 'files': ['contrib/tempest/tempest/services/share/json/shares_client.py', 'contrib/tempest/tempest/api/share/test_rules.py'], 'message': 'Tempest: wait for access rule to be deleted

The tests targeting user based access rules do not wait when
deleting such access rules. As multiple tests will create access
rules for the same user, this operation will fail if the previous
rule was not deleted in time.

This patch fixes those tests by waiting for the access rule delete
operation to complete.

The wait_for_resource_deletion method is updated to work with
access rules, re-adding previously existing functionality, removed

Closes-Bug: #1489367

Change-Id: Ie48fba56668ad663be84b74cd64927e3e5d6c675
'}]
commit_message:
Tempest: wait for access rule to be deleted

The tests targeting user based access rules do not wait when
deleting such access rules. As multiple tests will create access
rules for the same user, this operation will fail if the previous
rule was not deleted in time.

This patch fixes those tests by waiting for the access rule delete
operation to complete.

The wait_for_resource_deletion method is updated to work with
access rules, re-adding previously existing functionality, removed
as unused and also requested by bug/1429952.

Closes-Bug: #1489367

Change-Id: Ie48fba56668ad663be84b74cd64927e3e5d6c675

subject: List LPARs before querying for a given CNA
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-27 18:51:03.000000000', 'files': ['neutron_powervm/tests/unit/plugins/ibm/powervm/test_sea_agent.py', 'neutron_powervm/plugins/ibm/agent/powervm/utils.py', 'neutron_powervm/plugins/ibm/agent/powervm/sea_agent.py'], 'message': "List LPARs before querying for a given CNA

This change set will list all of the VM UUIDs out during the
UpdateVLANRequest.  It does this so that it does not query for the CNA's
on VMs that do not exist.

This caused issues in the backing PowerVM API due to a tremendous number
of requests for elements that did not exist.  This reduces that load
dramatically as the majority were coming from Neutron.

Change-Id: I36ba4de7cb2b16981cf10f4e9825436ab2240a64
"}]
commit_message:
List LPARs before querying for a given CNA

This change set will list all of the VM UUIDs out during the
UpdateVLANRequest.  It does this so that it does not query for the CNA's
on VMs that do not exist.

This caused issues in the backing PowerVM API due to a tremendous number
of requests for elements that did not exist.  This reduces that load
dramatically as the majority were coming from Neutron.

Change-Id: I36ba4de7cb2b16981cf10f4e9825436ab2240a64

subject: Remove temporary upgrade task that removes profile
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-08-27 21:05:32.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/run-upgrade.sh'], 'message': 'Remove temporary upgrade task that removes profile

When performing an upgrade, this project strives to have minimal
downtime for VMs that are running. By removing the apparmor profile as a
precondition for upgrades, when the container create role runs, the
profile will default to contained (the most restrictive profile). This
causes instance downtime since neutron can not create network
namespaces.

Related-bug: 1487130
Closes-bug: 1489144
Change-Id: Ife7aab044c7cb882a89c6b108b2d66f5e39aa10c
(cherry picked from commit 999cdf52d793e171d0b26c6da1bf786972a6f137)
'}]
commit_message:
Remove temporary upgrade task that removes profile

When performing an upgrade, this project strives to have minimal
downtime for VMs that are running. By removing the apparmor profile as a
precondition for upgrades, when the container create role runs, the
profile will default to contained (the most restrictive profile). This
causes instance downtime since neutron can not create network
namespaces.

Related-bug: 1487130
Closes-bug: 1489144
Change-Id: Ife7aab044c7cb882a89c6b108b2d66f5e39aa10c
(cherry picked from commit 999cdf52d793e171d0b26c6da1bf786972a6f137)

This patch either needs to be compatible with 0.11 and 0.13, or we need a new 0.13 package and update global-requirements lower end cap on it. Change-Id: I853f14a813b68faa57b3751fff8486e37c3014a5 '}]
commit_message: Revert "Fix broken header dropdowns" This reverts commit 59a183aed82552462bb814fc13abb1f0217bca03. With 0.11 this causes every to require 2 clicks for opening - first click selects it, second opens. There is not even a package for XStatic-Angular-Bootstrap 0.13 yet. This patch either needs to be compatible with 0.11 and 0.13, or we need a new 0.13 package and update global-requirements lower end cap on it. Change-Id: I853f14a813b68faa57b3751fff8486e37c3014a5

subject: Fix the URI parameter of 'List shared images' in Image service API v1
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-08-28 00:46:48.000000000', 'files': ['api-ref/src/wadls/image-api/src/v1/samples/imagemembershiplist.json', 'api-ref/src/wadls/image-api/src/v1/samples/shared-images.json', 'api-ref/src/wadls/image-api/src/v1/os-image-1.0.wadl', 'api-ref/src/wadls/image-api/src/v1/samples/imagelist.json', 'api-ref/src/wadls/image-api/src/v1/samples/imagememberships.json', 'api-ref/src/wadls/image-api/src/v1/samples/imagedetails.json', 'api-ref/src/wadls/image-api/src/v1/common.ent'], 'message': "Fix the URI parameter of 'List shared images' in Image service API v1

The original URI of this API is '/v1/shared-images/{owner}'.
But there is no specific description of the parameter 'owner'.
Meanwhile the other APIs in the same page are using 'owner_id'
instead of 'owner'.

So the following changes are made.
 - Change the URI from '/v1/shared-images/{owner}' to '/v1/shared-images/{owner_id}'.
 - Add the description of the parameter 'owner_id' as request parameter.
 - Move the image_id, owner_id and can_share parameters to common.ent
   and reference those entities from the WADL.
 - Add return at end of code samples - those were missing.

Change-Id: I7b178f619266ddd93af48921c16561831bf1287c
Closes-Bug: #1489383
"}]
commit_message:
Fix the URI parameter of 'List shared images' in Image service API v1

The original URI of this API is '/v1/shared-images/{owner}'.
But there is no specific description of the parameter 'owner'.
Meanwhile the other APIs in the same page are using 'owner_id'
instead of 'owner'.

So the following changes are made.
 - Change the URI from '/v1/shared-images/{owner}' to '/v1/shared-images/{owner_id}'.
 - Add the description of the parameter 'owner_id' as request parameter.
 - Move the image_id, owner_id and can_share parameters to common.ent
   and reference those entities from the WADL.
 - Add return at end of code samples - those were missing.

Change-Id: I7b178f619266ddd93af48921c16561831bf1287c
Closes-Bug: #1489383

commit_message:
Remove maridb client from base image

Sam thinks this is the cause of the permissions issue.  Whether it
is or not, it is not necessary in the base image.  Sam suggested
using the same libraries throughout the deployment related to
mysql - seems to make sense to me.

commit_message:
devstack: explicit path in run_process calls

Since gnocchi can be tested in a virtualenv the calls to run_process
need to explicitly state the full path of the script or binary they
are running, otherwise they will not be found.

Change-Id: Ibe11d57bb4550746cc4e8d91920eac0bcd2ff67e

commit_message:
Don't filter removable block devices

list_block_devices should report all devices that it can find.
If an error occurs during block device analysing,
then it should be silently ignored and the device should be skipped.

This change will let provisioning to proceed if this skipped device
is not required for provisioning purposes.

Change-Id: I9399b1e0855493289e82f40ffd8c892f89412f1c
Related-Bug: #1486601

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 7226, 'name': 'Stan Lagun', 'email': 'stan.lagun@gmail.com', 'username': 'istalker2'}, {'_account_id': 7227, 'name': 'Timur Nurlygayanov', 'email': 'tnurlygayanov@mirantis.com', 'username': 'tnurlygayanov'}, {'_account_id': 7535, 'name': 'Nikolay Starodubtsev', 'email': 'starodubcevna@gmail.com', 'username': 'Kezar'}, {'_account_id': 7549, 'name': 'Ekaterina Chernova', 'email': 'katyafervent@yandex.ru', 'username': 'efedorova'}, {'_account_id': 7821, 'name': 'Murano CI', 'username': 'murano-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 13962, 'name': 'Victor Ryzhenkin', 'email': 'vryzhenkin@mirantis.com', 'username': 'vryzhenkin'}, {'_account_id': 14265, 'name': 'Filip Blaha', 'email': 'filip.blaha@hpe.com', 'username': 'fblaha'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-08-27 23:38:31.000000000', 'files': ['murano/dsl/typespec.py', 'murano/dsl/yaql_integration.py', 'murano/dsl/murano_method.py', 'murano/dsl/class_loader.py', 'murano/dsl/murano_object.py'], 'message': 'Namespace resolution error was fixed

For method invocation context of a sender object was used.
Then the current type was taken from it and class names were
resolved using namespaces of that class. However in situations
when contracted method was located in parent class that had
different namespace declarations it lead to a wrong namespaces
being used.

This commit adds information on which class has the contract
so that the sender could be upcasted to it first.

Change-Id: Ieb4fca4ea7f2c64c7a731b81fee2ccaff1b1a531
Closes-Bug: #1489524
'}]
commit_message:
Namespace resolution error was fixed

For method invocation context of a sender object was used.
Then the current type was taken from it and class names were
resolved using namespaces of that class. However in situations
when contracted method was located in parent class that had
different namespace declarations it lead to a wrong namespaces
being used.

This commit adds information on which class has the contract
so that the sender could be upcasted to it first.

Change-Id: Ieb4fca4ea7f2c64c7a731b81fee2ccaff1b1a531
Closes-Bug: #1489524

Currently, we specify defaults for the RedHat and Ubuntu
distribution families, and perform adjustments to these
in the playbooks based on checks for OS version, etc.
This is awkward. Instead, import defaults files in increasing

Change-Id: I60b5a1f1c1f63fe4c742599a5a8a12a80cd15652
'}]
commit_message:
Support for fine-grained distro-related defaults

Currently, we specify defaults for the RedHat and Ubuntu
distribution families, and perform adjustments to these
in the playbooks based on checks for OS version, etc.
This is awkward. Instead, import defaults files in increasing
order of specificity to tune the install for each distribution
and version without extra playbook items.

Change-Id: I60b5a1f1c1f63fe4c742599a5a8a12a80cd15652

subject: Correct bug with default value where required
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-08-27 21:13:21.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/roles/bifrost-create-dib-image/tasks/main.yml'], 'message': 'Correct bug with default value where required

We did not default imagetype and as such running the image build
path failed.  This sets a default setting to allow file detection
and the playbook not to fail.

Change-Id: Ie5d414e85cd8b145dc2463f833c76c41e0b9c55c
Closes-Bug: #1488958
'}]
commit_message:
Correct bug with default value where required

We did not default imagetype and as such running the image build
path failed.  This sets a default setting to allow file detection
and the playbook not to fail.

Change-Id: Ie5d414e85cd8b145dc2463f833c76c41e0b9c55c
Closes-Bug: #1488958

commit_message:
Use oslo.versionedobjects enums instead of status strings

Statuses are currently defined as a StringField when they should
be defined as an Enum object.  This fix changes these objects from
using StringField by extending the Enum object in
oslo.versionedobjects

Change-Id: I12760e1d72f4af9931ee97bbad298f92f785118f
Partial-Bug: #1489136

2. get_services_by_bay_uuid

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-24 17:32:22.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/devref/sub_project_guidelines.rst', 'doc/source/devref/index.rst', 'doc/source/devref/sub_projects.rst'], 'message': "devref: added guidelines on how to maintain sub-projects

I was involved lately in several boring attempts to fix broken
sub-project requirements and stable branches, and I think part of the
problem here is that we don't communicate our expectations to
sub-projects clear enough.

This is a first attempt to set brief and clear guidelines to sub-project
maintainers on how to maintain their repositories without much hassle.

Change-Id: I9180ee530f96a885b5667e050d141ce0ab52a8ce
"}]
commit_message:
devref: added guidelines on how to maintain sub-projects

I was involved lately in several boring attempts to fix broken
sub-project requirements and stable branches, and I think part of the
problem here is that we don't communicate our expectations to
sub-projects clear enough.

This is a first attempt to set brief and clear guidelines to sub-project
maintainers on how to maintain their repositories without much hassle.

Change-Id: I9180ee530f96a885b5667e050d141ce0ab52a8ce

subject: Fix formatting in process_bugs.py output
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-24 21:36:02.000000000', 'files': ['process_bugs.py'], 'message': "Fix formatting in process_bugs.py output

The recent changes to use print() instead of print mean we started
having more newlines, which in turn means the output is much longer than
it used to be. Restore the same formatting, and fix some prints that
didn't have the () so weren't being called.

Change-Id: I55f8c8bfe899bc0bb57cdf4f4a4b49ffd146ff94
"}]
commit_message:
Fix formatting in process_bugs.py output

The recent changes to use print() instead of print mean we started
having more newlines, which in turn means the output is much longer than
it used to be. Restore the same formatting, and fix some prints that
didn't have the () so weren't being called.

Change-Id: I55f8c8bfe899bc0bb57cdf4f4a4b49ffd146ff94

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-27 17:53:38.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute.py', 'nova/compute/manager.py'], 'message': "Don't trace on InstanceInfoCacheNotFound when refreshing network info_cache

We trace the exception when hitting InstanceInfoCacheNotFound while refreshing
the network info_cache, which is a normal case if the instance is being deleted
from under us.  We should remove the trace.

Change-Id: I85f0f6dc541b2af48ae3ea3d36c742c1a52a83b6
Closes-bug: 1441361
"}]
commit_message:
Don't trace on InstanceInfoCacheNotFound when refreshing network info_cache

We trace the exception when hitting InstanceInfoCacheNotFound while refreshing
the network info_cache, which is a normal case if the instance is being deleted
from under us.  We should remove the trace.

Change-Id: I85f0f6dc541b2af48ae3ea3d36c742c1a52a83b6
Closes-bug: 1441361

Move cli_nova_evacuate.rst out of common/

The Cloud Admin Guide compute-node-down.rst file
has been reworked to link to the User Admin User
Guide rather than include cli_nova_evacuate.rst

This means that cli_nova_evacuate.rst is no
longer a common file, and it has been moved into

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-08-28 07:51:06.000000000', 'files': ['requirements.txt', 'oslo_messaging/tests/test_utils.py', 'test-requirements.txt', 'amqp1-requirements.txt', 'setup.py', 'oslo_messaging/tests/test_opts.py', 'requirements-py3.txt', 'test-requirements-py3.txt', 'setup-test-env-qpid.sh', 'oslo_messaging/tests/functional/gate/post_test_hook.sh'], 'message': "Fix gate jobs in stable/kilo (4 backports)

This patch contains 4 backports from master. Unfortunately, an update on
f21 is forcing to update the requirements for amqp1. Therefore, we need
these 2 commits, which depend on each other, to be backported as one.
To fix py27 unittests we should backport two more patches as well.

Commit 1:

Enable amqp's protocol unit tests everywhere

Now that python-qpid-proton has taken an approach similar to zmq's, it's
possible to install it in boxes where the C libraries are not present in
the system. This patch takes advantage of that to enable amqp protocol's
tests everywhere.

Note that the backport was modified to match the stable/kilo gate
configuration. This job, in Kilo, is supposed to run *just* on f21,
therefore, I've removed the changes to the tox.ini to avoid installing
the dependencies everywhere.

Master-Change-Id: Ibce4c791aafadf45fa876d6a4f5373fde94769ff
(cherry picked from commit f06b19628fbb11a32797f1095eba7c07b6343433)

Commit 2:

Fix qpid's functional gate

The loggin verbosity changed in 0.32 which our gate is pulling from the
updates repository. This patch updates the script to make it work again.

Closes-bug: #1468917
Master-Change-Id: I88a1bc794246beb156d4301bd503fa51a7cd2cce
(cherry picked from commit 079c04f0d06539f3507c772ccc68807a6d01a73a)

Commit 3:

Fix list_opts test to not check all deps

The list_opts entrypoint test failed unnecessarily when the
dependencies in the packages were inconsistent. This test doesn't
need to verify that the dependencies are consistent, only that the
entrypoint is available and provides the expected function.

(cherry picked from commit 3d483fda709d2d04db2222e0119eaa54de5f5867)

Commit 4:

Fix mock use for mock 1.1.0

Correct the way we check the calls by using the proper mock method. Add
a new test to expand coverage of the area being fixed.

(cherry picked from commit c7b31385ac3616060ef0f2188fb724191caad03c, but
the new tests was removed)

Co-Authored-By: Viktor Serhieiev <vsergeyev@mirantis.com>

Closes-Bug: #1488456
Change-Id: If781c808b1f1428dbc24b92cd0b8f8b7904c0ed4
"}]
commit_message:
Fix gate jobs in stable/kilo (4 backports)

This patch contains 4 backports from master. Unfortunately, an update on
f21 is forcing to update the requirements for amqp1. Therefore, we need
these 2 commits, which depend on each other, to be backported as one.
To fix py27 unittests we should backport two more patches as well.

Commit 1:

Enable amqp's protocol unit tests everywhere

Now that python-qpid-proton has taken an approach similar to zmq's, it's
possible to install it in boxes where the C libraries are not present in
the system. This patch takes advantage of that to enable amqp protocol's
tests everywhere.

Note that the backport was modified to match the stable/kilo gate
configuration. This job, in Kilo, is supposed to run *just* on f21,
therefore, I've removed the changes to the tox.ini to avoid installing
the dependencies everywhere.

Master-Change-Id: Ibce4c791aafadf45fa876d6a4f5373fde94769ff
(cherry picked from commit f06b19628fbb11a32797f1095eba7c07b6343433)

Commit 2:

Fix qpid's functional gate

The loggin verbosity changed in 0.32 which our gate is pulling from the
updates repository. This patch updates the script to make it work again.

Closes-bug: #1468917
Master-Change-Id: I88a1bc794246beb156d4301bd503fa51a7cd2cce
(cherry picked from commit 079c04f0d06539f3507c772ccc68807a6d01a73a)

Commit 3:

Fix list_opts test to not check all deps

The list_opts entrypoint test failed unnecessarily when the
dependencies in the packages were inconsistent. This test doesn't
need to verify that the dependencies are consistent, only that the
entrypoint is available and provides the expected function.

(cherry picked from commit 3d483fda709d2d04db2222e0119eaa54de5f5867)

Commit 4:

Fix mock use for mock 1.1.0

Correct the way we check the calls by using the proper mock method. Add
a new test to expand coverage of the area being fixed.

(cherry picked from commit c7b31385ac3616060ef0f2188fb724191caad03c, but
the new tests was removed)

Co-Authored-By: Viktor Serhieiev <vsergeyev@mirantis.com>

Closes-Bug: #1488456
Change-Id: If781c808b1f1428dbc24b92cd0b8f8b7904c0ed4

commit_message:
glusterfs_native: Add create share from snapshot

Add the missing create share from snapshot feature in gluster_native
driver. The snapshot of a share/GlusterFS volume, is cloned to create
a new GlusterFS volume that is served as a new share.

Change-Id: I93208a844a18423e3ade6cfed0f34c8da3c1c598

Implements: blueprint ipv6-prefix-delegation

commit_message:
L3 agent changes and reference implementation for IPv6 PD

This patch adds the common framework to be used by specific
implementations of the DHCPv6 protocol for Prefix Delegation.

It also includes a reference implementation based on the Dibbler
DHCPv6 client. Dibbler version 1.0.1 or greater is required.
Sanity tests are included to verify the installed version.

A patch for admin/user documentation is up for review here:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/178739

Video guides for configuring and using this feature are available on
YouTube:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wI830s881HQ
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zfsFyS01Fn0

Co-Authored-By: Baodong (Robert) Li <baoli@cisco.com>
Co-Authored-By: Sam Betts <sam@code-smash.net>

Change-Id: Id94acbbe96c717f68f318b2d715dd9cb9cc7fe4f
Implements: blueprint ipv6-prefix-delegation

commit_message:
Add network support for os.nova.server profile

This patch adds network support for os.nova.server profile. User
can now configure the network of a nova server by defining the
network name or id, fixed-ip or port id.

Change-Id: I8dc01ae74378607b94d4d0e831af0ceca56b983a
